latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2979; text as passed Senate: CR S2966)

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2979; text as passed Senate: CR S2966)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S2979; text as passed Senate: CR S2966)

item.name: Introduced in Senate
item.text:
Designates April 23, 2013, as National Adopt A Library Day.

Honors organizations that help facilitate donations to schools and libraries.

Urges people in the United States who own unused books to donate them to local libraries.

item.name: Passed Senate without amendment
item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Designates April 23, 2013, as National Adopt A Library Day.

Honors organizations that help facilitate donations to schools and libraries.

Urges people in the United States who own unused books to donate them to local libraries.

bill.title: A resolution designating April 23, 2013 as "National Adopt a Library Day".

item.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

item.title: A resolution designating April 23, 2013 as "National Adopt a Library Day".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
